text:
Hello all, I have been working on a platform called "Distilled AI" - <https://distilledai.com/|https://distilledai.com/>

My ultimate goal with this place is to create a diverse community of people interested in advancements of AI field in general.

If we see, AI field is mostly filled with computer science people or people with technical background.

But as AI is going to touch almost everything, people from diverse background should be part of community.

To welcome them into AI community, we need to make AI & ML dead simpler for them.

So, that people with no CS / math background can understand how everything functions in AI / ML. Basics of the field in short.

That's what I try to do with this book.

I know goal is very big & hard to achieve but even if we can achieve 1% of the big pie, it's a big achievement!

See the thread for more information :point_down:

attachments.title: Distilled Artificial Intelligence for truly everyone | Distilled AI
attachments.text: This is the place for everyone, not just computer people, to learn what Artificial Intelligence is in easy non-technical & carefully summarized way.
attachments.fallback: Distilled AI: Distilled Artificial Intelligence for truly everyone | Distilled AI

text:
The main book which covers a very wide range of topics of AI & ML is "Distilled Artificial Intelligence".
<https://distilledai.com/distilled-artificial-intelligence/|https://distilledai.com/distilled-artificial-intelligence/>

Without requiring any computer science or math prerequisites, this book covers a wide range of fundamental concepts related to AI, machine learning & deep learning in pure simple non-technical language.

I have tried to make those concepts dead simpler without any math, while keeping the original concept intact.

Readers won't come to know when he/she learned a technical concept.


Alongside the core concepts of ML, I have not ignored the business side of them.

Book also covers how a company(organization) or a small startup can use these algorithms in their existing products/services & earn profits.

In other words, how to monetize AI & machine learning?


List of topics this book covers is very long. I recommend you to have a look at it here.
<https://distilledai.com/distilled-artificial-intelligence/#highlights|https://distilledai.com/distilled-artificial-intelligence/#highlights>


This book is built for people with no computer/maths background.

I have answered “what”, “why” & “how” questions to make things more clear.

Keeping the non-technical audience in mind, I have focused more on breadth of concepts than depth while covering all the essentials of the concept/topic.


What will a technical person get from this book?

Ability to "see & explain technical & mathematical ML concepts in a non-technical way" is a good skill to have.

Also it will help a technical person to understand the concept better from new non-technical perspectives.


There's a huge amount of diverse quality content about AI out there. 

To see an overview of the topics covered & highlights of the book, visit this official page.

attachments.title: Everything about Artificial Intelligence for everyone | Distilled AI
attachments.text: This book covers almost every topic of Artificial Intelligence in pure non-technical & easy words. Literally no prerequisites. Everyone can use this book.
attachments.fallback: Distilled AI: Everything about Artificial Intelligence for everyone | Distilled AI

text:
There's also one separate free book on “Business perspective in Artificial Intelligence”.
<https://distilledai.com/business-perspective-in-artificial-intelligence/|https://distilledai.com/business-perspective-in-artificial-intelligence/>

Which covers the business & monetization side of AI. How a company/startup can leverage AI to generate profits.

General idea behind this book is "Artificial Intelligence is not just about tools & algorithms."
We also should see the business side of it to make it useful in the long term.

attachments.title: How to keep business perspective in Artificial Intelligence? | Distilled AI
attachments.text: This FREE book shows how you can use Artificial Intelligence in your company & generate tons of revenues. A sharp business focused book for everyone.

text:
Hey, I’ve just come across your post.
You claim that
```I have answered "what", "why" & "how" questions to make things more clear.```
But all this information available by googling, for free, and the vast majority of papers and books are written by professionals. Why your explanation is better? And why I or someone else should spend 30$ for this book?

IMHO, it’s a very questionable way to make people pay for already explained information, but not give them any new knowledge.

I also think that the fundamentals in our field are math, cs, and passion, and it seems strange to pretend that these things are not important. It’s better to explain people math/cs or motivate them to learn it

I have answered "what", "why" & "how" questions to make things more clear.

IMHO, it’s a very questionable way to make people pay for already explained information, but not give them any new knowledge.

I also think that the fundamentals in our field are math, cs, and passion, and it seems strange to pretend that these things are not important. It’s better to explain people math/cs or motivate them to learn it

text:
Yes. <@U30LWK54N>, you're right.

All the basic information is available.
But not in very simpler way.

Have a look at number of diverse topics included in one single book.

And I have represented in a very basic way that everyone who can read English can understand.

The way I represent knowledge is very easy. Information is available online but not in this much easy way.

I may be biased here but,
I have read many many books, blogs & articles. Trust me, I have made it dead simpler to understand than most of them.

You're also right about Math is the correct way to teach AI.
But not many people have that kind of background.

To get the basics of almost all the concepts of ML, they need to understand maths.
But what if there's a way, we can understand them in intuitive manner without going into maths..?

This book solves that problem.

Have I answered your question..?

text: Not in the slightest. That's like trying to learn physics without going into maths. Just doesn't work, sorry. Wrong slack

elements.text: Not in the slightest. That's like trying to learn physics without going into maths. Just doesn't work, sorry. Wrong slack

text:
True
But we can atleast get intuition of Physics concepts without Maths right?

That's what most people want.
Getting the intuition.

Very very few people have mathematical understanding enough to understand Physics

But they all know what gravity is.
"Earth's power to attract, is gravity."

We don't require Maths to understand that statement!

People assume they need Maths to understand basics of something.

But almost every concept of Physics or Machine learning, we can convey what it is intuitively
With no requirement of Maths
